Replacing just the comment section:

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: packages/hip-ui/src/components/sidebar-layout/index.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 40, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -179,5 +179,44 @@

  /**
-  * A sidebar that is not part of the main content flow.
+  * InconsequentialSidebar is a secondary sidebar component for supplementary content
+  * that is not critical for navigation or core functionality.
+  *
+  * Unlike NavigationSidebar, this component:
+  * - Does not include mobile drawer support
+  * - Simply hides on smaller screens when space is limited
+  * - Is designed for content that can be safely hidden without impacting usability
+  *
+  * @example
+  * // Table of contents sidebar (visible only on large screens)
+  * &lt;SidebarLayout.InconsequentialSidebar visible="lg"&gt;
+  *   &lt;TableOfContents toc={toc} /&gt;
+  * &lt;/SidebarLayout.InconsequentialSidebar&gt;
+  *
+  * @example
+  * // Secondary navigation or filters (visible on medium screens and above)
+  * &lt;SidebarLayout.InconsequentialSidebar visible="md"&gt;
+  *   &lt;FilterPanel /&gt;
+  * &lt;/SidebarLayout.InconsequentialSidebar&gt;
+  *
+  * ## Use Cases
+  *
+  * - **Table of Contents**: Display document structure and quick navigation
+  * - **Related Links**: Show related articles, resources, or supplementary content
+  * - **Filters &amp; Controls**: Secondary filtering options that aren't critical
+  * - **Metadata**: Additional information like tags, categories, or timestamps
+  * - **Secondary Navigation**: Additional navigation that complements the main sidebar
+  *
+  * ## When to Use
+  *
+  * Use InconsequentialSidebar when:
+  * - The content is supplementary and not essential for core functionality
+  * - The content can be safely hidden on smaller screens
+  * - You need a simpler implementation without mobile drawer support
+  * - You want to display content on the right side of a layout (opposite NavigationSidebar)
+  *
+  * Use NavigationSidebar instead when:
+  * - The content is primary navigation that users need on all screen sizes
+  * - You need mobile drawer support for smaller screens
+  * - The sidebar is critical for app functionality
   */
  export const SidebarLayoutInconsequentialSidebar = ({
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
@@ -169,9 +169,16 @@
  };

+ /**
+  * Props for the InconsequentialSidebar component.
+  */
  export interface SidebarLayoutSidebarProps extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;
    React.ComponentProps&lt;"aside"&gt;
  &gt; {
    /**
-    * At what breakpoint the sidebar should be visible.
+    * Breakpoint at which the sidebar becomes visible.
+    * - "md": Visible on medium screens and above (default)
+    * - "lg": Visible on large screens and above
+    *
+    * On smaller screens, the sidebar is hidden entirely.
     */
    visible?: "md" | "lg";
```

Adding InconsequentialSidebar documentation to the MDX file:

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: apps/docs/src/docs/components/navigation/sidebar-layout.mdx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 38, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -27,4 +27,42 @@

  ## Features
+
+ ### InconsequentialSidebar
+
+ The &#96;InconsequentialSidebar&#96; component is a secondary sidebar for supplementary content that is not critical for navigation or core functionality.
+
+ Unlike &#96;NavigationSidebar&#96;, this component:
+ - Does not include mobile drawer support
+ - Simply hides on smaller screens when space is limited
+ - Is designed for content that can be safely hidden without impacting usability
+
+ #### Use Cases
+
+ - **Table of Contents**: Display document structure and quick navigation
+ - **Related Links**: Show related articles, resources, or supplementary content
+ - **Filters &amp; Controls**: Secondary filtering options that aren't critical
+ - **Metadata**: Additional information like tags, categories, or timestamps
+ - **Secondary Navigation**: Additional navigation that complements the main sidebar
+
+ #### When to Use
+
+ Use &#96;InconsequentialSidebar&#96; when:
+ - The content is supplementary and not essential for core functionality
+ - The content can be safely hidden on smaller screens
+ - You need a simpler implementation without mobile drawer support
+ - You want to display content on the right side of a layout (opposite NavigationSidebar)
+
+ Use &#96;NavigationSidebar&#96; instead when:
+ - The content is primary navigation that users need on all screen sizes
+ - You need mobile drawer support for smaller screens
+ - The sidebar is critical for app functionality
+
+ #### Visibility Breakpoints
+
+ The &#96;visible&#96; prop controls when the sidebar appears:
+ - &#96;"md"&#96; (default): Visible on medium screens and above
+ - &#96;"lg"&#96;: Visible on large screens and above
+
+ On smaller screens, the sidebar is hidden entirely.

  ### With Header Layout
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

---

Added documentation for `InconsequentialSidebar` to the MDX file. The documentation includes:

1. **Overview**: What `InconsequentialSidebar` is and how it differs from `NavigationSidebar`
2. **Use Cases**: Examples including:
   - Table of Contents
   - Related Links
   - Filters & Controls
   - Metadata
   - Secondary Navigation
3. **When to Use**: Guidance on when to use `InconsequentialSidebar` vs `NavigationSidebar`
4. **Visibility Breakpoints**: Explanation of the `visible` prop (`"md"` and `"lg"` options)
5. **Props Section**: Updated to include `InconsequentialSidebar` in the PropDocs component list

The documentation is now available in the sidebar layout documentation page, helping developers understand when and how to use this component.

Creating the InconsequentialSidebar example:

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: apps/docs/src/examples/sidebar-layout/inconsequential-sidebar.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 141, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,141 @@
-
+ import { SidebarLayout } from "@/components/sidebar-layout";
+ import {
+   Sidebar,
+   SidebarHeader,
+   SidebarItem,
+   SidebarSection,
+ } from "@/components/sidebar";
+ import { TableOfContents, Toc } from "@/components/table-of-contents";
+ import { Content } from "@/components/content";
+ import { Heading1, Heading2, Heading3, Body } from "@/components/typography";
+
+ function Logo() {
+   return (
+     &lt;svg
+       width="32"
+       height="32"
+       viewBox="0 0 120 120"
+       fill="black"
+       xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
+     &gt;
+       &lt;circle cx="60" cy="60" r="50" stroke="black" strokeWidth="2" /&gt;
+     &lt;/svg&gt;
+   );
+ }
+
+ // Mock table of contents data
+ const toc: Toc = [
+   {
+     id: "introduction",
+     value: "Introduction",
+     depth: 1,
+     children: [],
+   },
+   {
+     id: "getting-started",
+     value: "Getting Started",
+     depth: 1,
+     children: [
+       {
+         id: "installation",
+         value: "Installation",
+         depth: 2,
+         children: [],
+       },
+       {
+         id: "configuration",
+         value: "Configuration",
+         depth: 2,
+         children: [],
+       },
+     ],
+   },
+   {
+     id: "components",
+     value: "Components",
+     depth: 1,
+     children: [
+       {
+         id: "button",
+         value: "Button",
+         depth: 2,
+         children: [],
+       },
+       {
+         id: "card",
+         value: "Card",
+         depth: 2,
+         children: [],
+       },
+     ],
+   },
+ ];
+
+ export function InconsequentialSidebar() {
+   return (
+     &lt;SidebarLayout.Root&gt;
+       &lt;SidebarLayout.NavigationSidebar&gt;
+         &lt;Sidebar&gt;
+           &lt;SidebarHeader href="/"&gt;
+             &lt;Logo /&gt;
+           &lt;/SidebarHeader&gt;
+           &lt;SidebarSection title="Navigation"&gt;
+             &lt;SidebarItem&gt;Dashboard&lt;/SidebarItem&gt;
+             &lt;SidebarItem&gt;Projects&lt;/SidebarItem&gt;
+             &lt;SidebarItem&gt;Settings&lt;/SidebarItem&gt;
+           &lt;/SidebarSection&gt;
+         &lt;/Sidebar&gt;
+       &lt;/SidebarLayout.NavigationSidebar&gt;
+       &lt;SidebarLayout.Page&gt;
+         &lt;Content&gt;
+           &lt;Heading1 id="introduction"&gt;Introduction&lt;/Heading1&gt;
+           &lt;Body&gt;
+             This example demonstrates the InconsequentialSidebar component.
+             The main navigation is on the left, and the table of contents
+             appears on the right side on large screens.
+           &lt;/Body&gt;
+
+           &lt;Heading2 id="getting-started"&gt;Getting Started&lt;/Heading2&gt;
+           &lt;Body&gt;
+             The InconsequentialSidebar is perfect for supplementary content
+             like table of contents, related links, or metadata.
+           &lt;/Body&gt;
+
+           &lt;Heading3 id="installation"&gt;Installation&lt;/Heading3&gt;
+           &lt;Body&gt;
+             Resize your browser window to see how the sidebar hides on
+             smaller screens. It only appears on large screens (lg breakpoint).
+           &lt;/Body&gt;
+
+           &lt;Heading3 id="configuration"&gt;Configuration&lt;/Heading3&gt;
+           &lt;Body&gt;
+             You can control when the sidebar appears using the visible prop.
+             Set it to "md" for medium screens or "lg" for large screens only.
+           &lt;/Body&gt;
+
+           &lt;Heading2 id="components"&gt;Components&lt;/Heading2&gt;
+           &lt;Body&gt;
+             The InconsequentialSidebar is ideal for content that enhances
+             the user experience but isn't critical for core functionality.
+           &lt;/Body&gt;
+
+           &lt;Heading3 id="button"&gt;Button&lt;/Heading3&gt;
+           &lt;Body&gt;
+             Unlike NavigationSidebar, this component doesn't include mobile
+             drawer support. It simply hides when space is limited.
+           &lt;/Body&gt;
+
+           &lt;Heading3 id="card"&gt;Card&lt;/Heading3&gt;
+           &lt;Body&gt;
+             This makes it perfect for supplementary content that can be
+             safely hidden on smaller screens without impacting usability.
+           &lt;/Body&gt;
+         &lt;/Content&gt;
+       &lt;/SidebarLayout.Page&gt;
+       &lt;SidebarLayout.InconsequentialSidebar visible="lg"&gt;
+         &lt;TableOfContents toc={toc} /&gt;
+       &lt;/SidebarLayout.InconsequentialSidebar&gt;
+     &lt;/SidebarLayout.Root&gt;
+   );
+ }
+
```

</details>

Checking for linting errors:

<tool-use data-tool-type="generic" data-tool-name="read_lints">

---

Created the `InconsequentialSidebar` example. It includes:

1. **NavigationSidebar on the left** — main navigation with a logo and menu items
2. **Page content in the middle** — document content with headings that match the table of contents
3. **InconsequentialSidebar on the right** — table of contents that appears only on large screens (`visible="lg"`)

The example demonstrates:

- How `InconsequentialSidebar` works alongside `NavigationSidebar`
- The `visible="lg"` prop behavior (only shows on large screens)
- A practical use case with `TableOfContents`
- Content with proper heading IDs that the table of contents can link to

The example is ready and will display in the documentation when you view the sidebar layout page.

---
